Rule Of Law.origin: [adopting the rule of law that is most persuasive in light of precedent, reason and policy " Wright v. Wright , 904 P.2d 403 (1995)"]

1.definition: an authoritative legal doctrine, principle, or precept applied to the facts of an appropriate case [adopting thethat is most persuasive in light of precedent, reason and policy ", 904 P.2d 403 (1995)"]
